item.title: The Body without Organs and Aronofsky's Black Swan
item.description: We have an essay due for our critical theory module this semester and I’ve chosen a topic that looks at deconstruction. This is the title: The idea of the self as a fixed entity is challenged by deconstruction and poststructural feminism. Explore the potential offered by the fragmentation of the self via discussion of these theories. For a separate module we had studied The Body without Organs (Deleuze and Guattari 2004) and I knew that I somehow wanted to incorporate this into my essay on poststructuralism.
